alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:18AM HST until February 17 at 12:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 1215 PM HST. * At 918 AM HST, emergency management reported that Highway 11 has been closed at Kawa Flats in the Kau District. This is from mile marker 56 to 62. Heavy rainfall has been occurring in the Kau District from the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park to Naalehu with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Low water crossings along Wood Valley Road are also expected to be impassable. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahala, Wood Valley, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Naalehu, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Waiohinu, Discovery Harbour and Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1215 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
